title: On the Regimen of Health (Fī tadbīr al-ṣiḥḥah
author: Ibn Maymūn (1135-1204)
description: On the Regimen of Health (Fī tadbīr al-ṣiḥḥah)  was written in 1198 CE for Nūr al-Dīn ’Alī, the eldest son of Saladin. It consists of four sections. The first contains a general ‘regimen of health’ to be followed by everyone, the second a general regimen for circumstances in which no doctor, or only an inadequate one, is available. The third section contains a regimen designed specifically for Nūr al-Dīn ’Alī, and the fourth consists of useful general advice.
